Korea's Reunification Supported by Albanian President
articles.content:
Korea's Reunification Supported by Albanian President 
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Korea should be reunified peacefully through dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south and the issue of the Korean peninsula solved fairly in the interests of the Korean people and the international community.
 Alfred Moisiu, president of the Republic of Albania, said this when receiving credentials from Kim Ha Dong, DPRK ambassador e. p. to the country, on March 9.    
 On the occasion the president noted that the government of Albania wanted to boost the relations with the DPRK in various fields, saying that the ties between the two countries have a long history.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Executive Director of UNICEF
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Executive Director of UNICEF
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met Carol Bellamy, executive director of the United Nations Children's Fund, and her party and conversed with them in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Pierrete Vu Thi, representative of the Office of the UNICEF in Pyongyang.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Kuwait Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Kuwait Appointed
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Ho Jong was appointed as new DPRK ambassador  e. p. to Kuwait, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Executive Director of UNICEF
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Executive Director of UNICEF
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the executive director of the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Carol Bellamy, executive director of the UNICEF, today.

Congratulatory Message to Russian President
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Russian President
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA ) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a congratulatory message to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin upon his reelection as president of Russia.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship between the two countries which have reached a new high stage would continue to expand and develop, the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of the people.
